    • omitZeroPatch

      public static String omitZeroPatch(String input)

    • areEqual

      public static boolean areEqual(String left, String right)
      Compares the two versions by taking ZeroPatches into account. Meaning that the following combinations will be equal.

      This method is equivalent to 

      return omitZeroPatch(left).equals(omitZeroPatch(right))
      and 
      return compare(left, right) == 0
      but slightly faster
      • 1.2.3 == 1.2.3
      • 1.2.0 == 1.2
      • 1.0 == 1.0.0
      While the following combinations won't be equal
      • 1.2.3 != 1.2.0
      • 1.0 != 1.0.1
      There is also a special case for invalid SemVer Strings. If at least one of the given Versions does not comply with the pattern MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH? the response will be false
      Parameters:
      left - version for comparison
      right - version for comparison
      Returns:
      true if both versions are equal

    • compare

      public static int compare(String left, String right)
